We're looking for individuals who are passionate about working in an agile, diverse, global team, who can reimagine tomorrow and deliver solutions that solve real problems.As a team, we live to take risks, push boundaries, and stretch beyond the comfort zone – with a vision to create technologies that drive human progress.Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound impact as a Senior Principal User Experience Researcher in Austin, Texas!OVERVIEW of RoleAs a Senior Principal User Experience Researcher, you will be responsible for understanding and representing the user in all phases of delivering Dell Technology solutions. While collaborating with key engineering and business partners, you will plan and execute foundational research that drives exceptional user-experiences across software products and design initiatives.You will:Deliver insight and discovery of meaningful user needs, wants and behaviors, while instilling a strong sense of user empathy and duty among our teammatesDefine and deliver an end-to-end user-centered design process across some of Dell’s most exciting end-user computing devices Ensure experiential designs achieve the highest level of usability, desirability, and customer satisfactionWork in an environment that allows you to apply cutting edge UX research and deliver products that touch millions of usersTake the first step towards your dream careerEvery Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:Essential RequirementsMS or PhD in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Cognitive Psychology, Design Anthropology or another appropriate discipline plus 8+ years of industry experience conducting user and design/experience research using various methods and working in-team with developers and designersExperience with a broad range of research methods, data collection and analytical techniques such as survey construction/analysis, UI prototype development, usability testing, focus group facilitation, and semi-structured and unstructured observational methods and statistical/quantitative and qualitative data analysisAbility to synthesize and summarize findings within and across studies and participants, identify key insights and opportunities, and work with designers and product owners to turn data into great user experiencesExceptional communication and storytelling skills – verbal, written, and experience engaging with executive stakeholders, product owners, development team members, business analysts/strategists, media representatives and customersAbility to drive success in an engineering and technology-driven organization                                                                                                                                                        Desirable RequirementsExperience executing marketing, brand, and strategy-oriented research methods including experience with customer segmentation, user taxonomies, and persona developmentDeep experience with product design and development, ideally across hardware/software and services ecosystemsAbility to lead design thinking, brainstorming or other similar user-centered design workshops towards evidence and insights-driven solutionsHere’s our story; now tell us yoursDell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow.
